questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about Oracle ASM? (Choose three.)

choices.F: Only the maximum of three ASM instances are supported in a cluster.
choices.E: ASM clients can fail over to other ASM instances.
choices.A: An ASM instance must run on every node of a cluster.
choices.C: It always requires a cluster to be installed and configured.
choices.D: A designated network is used for communication between ASM instances and their clients.
choices.B: The SPFILE and password file for ASM are stored by default in an ASM disk group.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
The question seems to refer to oracle FLEX ASM so answers are CDE as oracle said: https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/ostmg/manage-flex-asm.html

questions.question_text: Which two types of IP address details are administered using the srvctl command for Oracle Clusterware 19c? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
srvctl add scan/gns

choices.D: The Cluster Verification Utility (CLUVFY) may be used to check the cluster after installing the RAC database software.
choices.C: The Cluster Verification Utility (CLUVFY) must be used to check the cluster before installing the RAC database software.
choices.F: The RAC Database 12c software home and Grid Infrastructure homes must be owned by the same OS user.
choices.E: It is possible to install multiple RAC Database 12c software homes on the same cluster.
choices.A: The RAC Database 12c software home and Grid Infrastructure homes must be owned by separate OS users.
choices.B: It is possible to install RAC database software on a one-node cluster.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about Oracle 19c RAC Database software installations? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
BDE because is not mandatory run cluvfy

questions.question_text: Identify two reasons for the gc current block busy wait event. (Choose two.)

choices.C: A block is busy in the local cache.
choices.A: Either the local or the remote CPUs have too large a run queue.
choices.D: A block is busy in the remote cache.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
very busy remote server or block is used

choices.B: Stage the patch on the cluster node where the OPatch utility will be executed.
choices.D: Stage the patch on all cluster nodes.
choices.C: Update the PATH environment variable on the node where you will run the OPatch utility to point to the $ORACLE_HOME/OPatch directory.
choices.A: Update the PATH environment variable on each cluster node to point to the $ORACLE_HOME/OPatch directory.

questions.question_text: Which task must be performed before running the OPatch utility to patch Oracle Grid Infrastructure 19c?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think it is a bad question.
Techinically, DBA can use absolute path to use OPatch utility without setting PATH environment parameter. Also, the question is intended to ask which process must be done before issuing "OPatch" utility. As a result, if you would like to use "opatch version" to check the version of p6880 utility, you should set PATH parameter first. After that, you should stage the patch on the cluster where the OPatch utility will be executed. 
So, I would like to pickup "C: Update the PATH environment on the node where you will run..."

Selected Answer: B
You can use opatch -oh option instead of $ORACLE_HOME env but you have to have patch files on a node being patched. Thus, answer is B

comments.content: You can user fullpath to opatch and specify exact oracle home using "-oh". So it is optional

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A: Incorrect. You only need to update the PATH on the node where you'll run OPatch, not on all nodes.
B: Incorrect. Staging the patch on the execution node is essential but doesn't address updating the PATH.
D: Incorrect. Staging the patch on all nodes is redundant and unnecessary.
C: Correct. You must update the PATH environment variable on the node where you will run the OPatch utility to point to the $ORACLE_HOME/OPatch directory.

comments.content: Sorry B because C is optional, you can run opatch with full path

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I think C
D looks to be the answer, since the question is about using opatch with GI

Selected Answer: D
I think the question is tricky...

OPatch: A Java-based utility that enables the application and rollback of patches to Oracle software.

OPatchauto: A patch orchestration tool that generates patching instructions specific to your target configuration and then uses OPatch to perform the patching operations without user intervention. 

for opatchauto the patch can be copied on 1 node
for opatch utility the patch must be copied on all nodes

The question is about Opatch - I think D is correct

Selected Answer: B
patch can be copied just on the 1 node
